en: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

en: To do a great right do a little wrong.
author: William Shakespeare

en: Great achievement is usually born of great sacrifice, and is never the result of selfishness.
author: Napoleon Hill

en: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
author: William James

en: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

en: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
author: Winston Churchill

en: Greatness lies, not in being strong, but in the right using of strength; and strength is not used rightly when it serves only to carry a man above his fellows for his own solitary glory. He is the greatest whose strength carries up the most hearts by the attraction of his own.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

en: Whatever you want to do, if you want to be great at it, you have to love it and be able to make sacrifices for it.
author: Maya Angelou

en: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
author: William Shakespeare

en: All truly great thoughts are conceived by walking.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

en: Great acts are made up of small deeds.
author: Lao Tzu

en: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

en: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

en: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

en: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
author: Socrates

en: The great question that has never been answered, and which I have not yet been able to answer, despite my thirty years of research into the feminine soul, is 'What does a woman want?'
author: Sigmund Freud

en: Great things are done when men and mountains meet.
author: William Blake

en: It is the nature of all greatness not to be exact.
author: Edmund Burke

en: Good artists copy, great artists steal.
author: Pablo Picasso

en: I think what motivates people is not great hate, but great love for other people.
author: Huey Newton

en: Great people talk about ideas, average people talk about things, and small people talk about wine.
author: Fran Lebowitz

en: Nothing great in the world has ever been accomplished without passion.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

en: Be great in act, as you have been in thought.
author: Jean Paul

en: Laws control the lesser man... Right conduct controls the greater one.
author: Mark Twain

en: The price of greatness is responsibility.
author: Winston Churchill

en: That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.
author: Abraham Lincoln

en: All great achievements require time.
author: Maya Angelou

en: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
author: Maya Angelou

en: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

en: To be great is to be misunderstood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

en: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly and they will show themselves great.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

en: The demand to be loved is the greatest of all arrogant presumptions.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

en: Because of a great love, one is courageous.
author: Lao Tzu

en: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

en: Could a greater miracle take place than for us to look through each other's eyes for an instant?
author: Henry David Thoreau

en: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

en: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

en: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself; to be conquered by yourself is of all things most shameful and vile.
author: Plato

en: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
author: John F. Kennedy

en: It's hard to be humble, when you're as great as I am.
author: Muhammad Ali

en: I am the greatest, I said that even before I knew I was.
author: Muhammad Ali

en: The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

en: Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness, but it is greatness.
author: George Bernard Shaw

en: The greatest accomplishment is not in never falling, but in rising again after you fall.
author: Vince Lombardi

en: I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious.
author: Vince Lombardi

en: Great talents are the most lovely and often the most dangerous fruits on the tree of humanity. They hang upon the most slender twigs that are easily snapped off.
author: Carl Jung

en: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

en: Most great people have attained their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
author: Napoleon Hill

en: After climbing a great hill, one only finds that there are many more hills to climb.
author: Nelson Mandela

en: To have great poets, there must be great audiences.
author: Walt Whitman

en: One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody.
author: Mother Teresa

en: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
author: Oprah Winfrey

en: Do you wish to be great? Then begin by being. Do you desire to construct a vast and lofty fabric? Think first about the foundations of humility. The higher your structure is to be, the deeper must be its foundation.
author: Saint Augustine

en: The greatest mistake we make is living in constant fear that we will make one.
author: John C. Maxwell

en: Lives of great men all remind us, we can make our lives sublime, and, departing, leave behind us, footprints on the sands of time.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

en: The heights by great men reached and kept were not attained by sudden flight, but they, while their companions slept, were toiling upward in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

en: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

en: There would be no great men if there were no little ones.
author: George Herbert

en: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

en: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
author: Robert Kennedy

en: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

en: The world's great men have not commonly been great scholars, nor its great scholars great men.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

en: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

en: The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.
author: William Arthur Ward

en: Never was anything great achieved without danger.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

en: A retentive memory may be a good thing, but the ability to forget is the true token of greatness.
author: Elbert Hubbard

en: The greatest mistake you can make in life is continually fearing that you'll make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

en: Life in abundance comes only through great love.
author: Elbert Hubbard

en: The final proof of greatness lies in being able to endure criticism without resentment.
author: Elbert Hubbard

en: Whatever I have tried to do in life, I have tried with all my heart to do it well; whatever I have devoted myself to, I have devoted myself completely; in great aims and in small I have always thoroughly been in earnest.
author: Charles Dickens

en: Great men are seldom over-scrupulous in the arrangement of their attire.
author: Charles Dickens

en: As a child of God, I am greater than anything that can happen to me.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

en: Behind every great fortune lies a great crime.
author: Honore de Balzac

en: There is no such thing as a great talent without great will power.
author: Honore de Balzac

en: Believe that with your feelings and your work you are taking part in the greatest; the more strongly you cultivate this belief, the more will reality and the world go forth from it.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

en: Don't be humble... you're not that great.
author: Golda Meir

en: One sees great things from the valley; only small things from the peak.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

en: There is no greatness where there is no simplicity, goodness and truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

en: I've got a great ambition to die of exhaustion rather than boredom.
author: Thomas Carlyle

en: I believe the first test of a truly great man is in his humility.
author: John Ruskin

en: To be really great in little things, to be truly noble and heroic in the insipid details of everyday life, is a virtue so rare as to be worthy of canonization.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

en: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
author: Chanakya

en: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

en: Good health and good sense are two of life's greatest blessings.
author: Publilius Syrus

en: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

en: You need a little bit of insanity to do great things.
author: Henry Rollins

en: See everything, overlook a great deal, correct a little.
author: Pope John XXIII

en: He who would accomplish little must sacrifice little; he who would achieve much must sacrifice much; he who would attain highly must sacrifice greatly.
author: James Allen

en: The great man is he who does not lose his child's-heart.
author: Mencius

en: To become truly great, one has to stand with people, not above them.
author: Montesquieu

en: Believe deep down in your heart that you're destined to do great things.
author: Joe Paterno

en: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.
author: Moliere

en: Seek not greatness, but seek truth and you will find both.
author: Horace Mann

en: And what he greatly thought, he nobly dared.
author: Homer

en: There is no personal charm so great as the charm of a cheerful temperament.
author: Henry Van Dyke

en: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above them.
author: Washington Irving

en: Great wisdom is generous; petty wisdom is contentious. Great speech is impassioned, small speech cantankerous.
author: Zhuangzi

en: Great things are won by great dangers.
author: Herodotus

en: Life should be great rather than long.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

en: A great man is different from an eminent one in that he is ready to be the servant of the society.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

en: Heaven and hell suppose two distinct species of men, the good and the bad. But the greatest part of mankind float betwixt vice and virtue.
author: David Hume

en: Only passions, great passions can elevate the soul to great things.
author: Denis Diderot

en: The principles of living greatly include the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and trial with humility.
author: Thomas S. Monson

en: You are your greatest asset. Put your time, effort and money into training, grooming, and encouraging your greatest asset.
author: Tom Hopkins
